snippet: Borrowers need relief, and banks need to be held accountable for the mortgage mess.
abstract: Editorial laments that six months after the big banks settled with state and federal officials over evidence of widespread foreclosure fraud borrowers have been offered little relief and banks have still not been held accountable for the mortgage mess; warns that the economy will not recover and justice will not be done unless and until the mortgage crisis is resolved.
lead_paragraph: Borrowers need relief, and banks need to be held accountable for the mortgage mess.

headline.seo: Still No Justice for Mortgage Abuses
